text:
Hello. I received several receipts for credit card payments made to JuliaHub for trying out the Run code feature on the cloud. I have, however, not seen any sign of the 25 dollar credit I was supposed to get. How can I see a full accounting of my JuliaHub billing?

Thanks,
doug

elements.text:
Hello. I received several receipts for credit card payments made to JuliaHub for trying out the Run code feature on the cloud. I have, however, not seen any sign of the 25 dollar credit I was supposed to get. How can I see a full accounting of my JuliaHub billing?

Thanks,
doug

text: Hi Doug, the CC charges should be after the credit is applied automatically. I'll get someone to double check and send you a full accounting. More accessible usage reports are a work in progress.

elements.text: Hi Doug, the CC charges should be after the credit is applied automatically. I'll get someone to double check and send you a full accounting. More accessible usage reports are a work in progress.

text: Thanks, I find it hard to believe I used up all my $25 with a bunch of false starts and failed jobs. The taxi meter is pretty unforgivable!

elements.text: Thanks, I find it hard to believe I used up all my $25 with a bunch of false starts and failed jobs. The taxi meter is pretty unforgivable!

text: BTW, failed jobs that fail in the first couple of minutes are not charged at all.

elements.text: BTW, failed jobs that fail in the first couple of minutes are not charged at all.

text: So having audited the charges, it seems the credit was not applied to your account. We have rules to apply the credit for one month's invoices only, and it seems for your account we generated an invoice with your first job. So the credit got applied to that, and hence did not get applied to the month end invoices.

elements.text: So having audited the charges, it seems the credit was not applied to your account. We have rules to apply the credit for one month's invoices only, and it seems for your account we generated an invoice with your first job. So the credit got applied to that, and hence did not get applied to the month end invoices.

text: We've reverted the charges upto $25. You should be left with the remaining, which is pretty small.

elements.text: We've reverted the charges upto $25. You should be left with the remaining, which is pretty small.

text: Sorry for the trouble. We're auditing all our other clients as well to ensure no one else has been charged extra.

elements.text: Sorry for the trouble. We're auditing all our other clients as well to ensure no one else has been charged extra.

text: Ah, thanks for saying something!  We definitely need to make that clearer.

elements.text: Ah, thanks for saying something!  We definitely need to make that clearer.
